shows.title: Trends & Predictions / UFO Phenomena
shows.first_half: First Half: Founder and director of the Trends Research Institute, Gerald Celente, will talk about what he sees on the horizon for the United States, and the rapidly changing global landscape. He regularly provides business and industry with customized presentations and research studies in over 300 trend categories.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Canadian author, researcher, and historical analyst Grant Cameron will discuss his latest research in the UFO field, as well as the intersection of consciousness and UFO phenomena. He'll also share alien abductee reports and explore the role of vibration and heartbeat tracking.

shows.title: Mastering Anxiety / Akashic Records & Angels
shows.first_half: First Half: Prof. David H. Rosmarin will talk about how anxiety, one of the most common and misunderstood human emotions, can actually be a source of strength. He will share a four-step process to transform anxiety into a tool for growth, and explain how we can partner with it to perform better, and live more fully.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Akashic Records teacher Amy Robeson will reveal how her lifelong connection with angels began, and how its evolved. She'll delve into radiant color frequencies and their link to the crystalline realms, as well as how the Akashic Records reveal past lives, soul contracts, and cosmic lineages.

shows.title: Current Events & Prophecy / Dark Happenings
shows.first_half: First Half: Former military intelligence analyst Benjamin Baruch will discuss the major issues of our time, including intelligence updates regarding the U.S., NATO, and the Axis powers. He'll draw the connection between current scenarios and their connection to biblical prophecy.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and experiencer of dark happenings, Diane Satterfield, will share her personal, paranormal, and otherworldly experiences. She'll talk about how she, her family, and friends were drawn into this world of odd, strange, and sometimes beautiful, sometimes terrifying experiences.

shows.title: Vampires: Past & Present / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Father Sebastiaan, who has been active in the vampire subculture since 1992, joins guest host Richard Syrett. They'll discuss the role that vampires have played in the past, and what they mean in our modern day. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Richard a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
